title_sort: walt whitman to richard maurice bucke, 24 august 1889
title: Walt Whitman to Richard Maurice Bucke, 24 August 1889
text: Camden am Aug 24 '89 Am easiser than during the week, but bad enough yet—Have made away with my breakfast (wet Graham toast, honey & tea the last three or four days)—am sitting here in the big chair, by window—cloudy & half rainy to-day—a jolly letter f'm Ernest Rhys f'm Wales wh- I enclose—yr's rec'd this mng—thanks— —was formally requested (did I tell you?) to write an article "Tennyson at 81" for the Oct. No of the N A Review — by the new owners— — but have been too ill to try it, & shall probably give it the go-by — (I don't know but I have said I w all I want to say ab't T any how)—the sun out— & warm —It is ab't noon as I finish—I am feeling sort o' comfortable—Mrs. D and one of hte boys have gone over to Phila: wharf somewhere to see an old staunch ship the "Emily Reed" involved in their family history—Ed is here taking care—Luck & prayers.Walt Whitman Walt Whitman to Richard Maurice Bucke, 24 August 1889
